results.title: Princess of the Blood robes costume from The Last Emperor
results.brief_description: This costume from The Last Emperor enlivens the Imperial court with rich reds that bring grandeur to the screen, a sense that’s reinforced by 9,500 extras who appear to be draped in delicately embroidered silk thanks to screen-printed rayon.
results.title_for_label: Princess of the Blood robes from The Last Emperor
results.description:
From seller: A Princess of the Blood gown and overrobe from the 1987 multi Oscar-winning historical drama The Last Emperor. These women can be seen on several occasions throughout the movie, when PuYi chooses his secondary consort, and at PuYi’s wedding to the Empress. This stunning and elaborate costume consists of a full-length gown of printed red rayon satin, overprinted with dragon robe motif, similarly printed sleeveless overrobe. Also included is a black satin headband with gold filigree buttons (some have been lost over the years) and a string of glass beads and polished stones that hang down the chest, and a cream quilted cotton under robe.
It comes from the private collection of renowned producer Jeremy Thomas (who single handedly raised the $25million budget for the movie) and was archived after filming completed until only recently, when the Prop Store was proud to assist in sorting and cataloguing the incredible inventory under the guidance and in collaboration with Oscar-winning Costume Designer, Jim Acheson.
description_for_label: Colour had arrived in cinema when The Last Emperor (1987) was released but its use in costume and cinematography was Oscar-winning. The film follows Pu Yi’s transition from the last emperor of China to ordinary citizen and colour is fundamental to his journey. Deep crimson and orange hues capture both the majesty and innocence of his childhood in the Forbidden City, while grey saturates moments in jail later in life. This costume by James Acheson enlivens the Imperial court with rich reds that bring grandeur to the screen, further reinforced by 9,500 extras that appear to be draped in delicately embroidered silk thanks to screen-printed rayon.

details.label: Measurements
display_values:
HAT
Hat internals: 160mm length x 150mm width (oval shaped)

External diameter approx. 1050mm
Height from base of hat approx. 350mm

INTERNAL CALICO DRESS (inner layer)
Sits under robe and vest dress, see those object measurements

results.title: Like drowning
results.creator_credit: Catherine Murphy, Ann Shenfield, Paul Fletcher, Robert Stephenson and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A moving animated tale about a young family who try to come to terms with the sudden death of one of the children through drowning. The family struggles to cope and adopt drastic changes in their lifestyle in order to come to terms with the ordeal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine Murphy, Ann Shenfield, Paul Fletcher, Robert Stephenson and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: Melbourne (no. 8)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Shot of Yarra, looking towards Anderson St bridge.

Section 2. Royal Melbourne Show. Shots of various farm machinery on display. Crowds of people walking around enjoying themselves. Wood-chopping competition. Ladies riding horses, horse racing. More wood-chopping.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 4)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Several shots of daffodils in a park. Nice colour, long shots.

Section 2. Shots in a park near the Yarra looking towards the city.

Section 3. Shots of Fitzroy gardens, conservatory and Government House.

Section 4. Shots of large houses in Toorak.

Section 5. ANZAC day march in the city. Many people involved.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 2)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Football match between Carlton and Richmond at Punt Road oval. Huge crowd. Good shots of football being played and the crowd reacting to the game.

Section 2. Two women at an observation point above the city.

Section 3. Shot of State Library with tram going past, shot of two statues in the city.

Section 4. Shots taken from behind St Paul’s cathederal looking down towards the Yarra, MCG and Flinders St train tracks.

Section 5. Shots of various statues and fountains around Melbourne.

Section 6. Shot from car driving along St Kilda Road, away from the city.

Section 7. Shots of city in the afternoon. Busy scene with Cars, buses, trams and people.

Section 8. Shot looking towards city from bank of Yarra. A man sits on a park bench in the foreground, surrounded by Seagulls.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 3)
results.brief_description: Film features quite general shots of Melbourne in the summer. This includes footage of the Great Ocean Road (including panoramas), a busy suburban pool and St. Kilda Beach. These sequences have a great, nostalgic ‘good time’ vibe to them, which is aided in part by the high-contrast film stock. There is also footage of one of Melbourne’s Gardens (possibly the Botanic), including blooming flowers and people looking at them. Nice shots of man burning leaves followed by the sun breaking through smoke haze and trees in garden. Two shots include views of St. Paul’s Cathederal and the Forum Theatre from the Yarra. Nice, Black and White ‘The End’.

results.title: Night out
results.brief_description: A young man is savagely bashed when he visits a toilet beat for sex. The assault forces a reassessment of the relationship he has with his boyfriend, as well as resulting in a self-examination of his own needs and desires. “Night out” is an intense Australian short that is as much about the intricacies and uncertainties of contemporary sexual relationships as it is about the violation and humiliation of physical assault. Official entry in the “Un Certain Regard” section of the 1990 Cannes Film Festival.
results.description: A young man is savagely bashed when he visits a toilet beat for sex. results.title: Mr Wasinski's Song
results.brief_description: While visiting an ear doctor Mr Wasinski discovers that his deafness is linked to a frightening childhood experience. During his consultation the doctor discovers gauze buried deep within his ear canal and upon its removal Mr. Wasinski becomes vulnerable to a barrage of repressed childhood memories. Having lived as a child in Poland during Nazi occupation Mr. Wasinski’s deafness marks the loss of his innocence as a child when separated from his parents during a desperate attempt to escape. The vivid memories suppressed with the aid of his deafness prove a challenge to an aging man who seeks distance from his childhood experiences. Stars Bruce Kerr as Mr Wasinski.
results.description: While visiting an ear doctor Mr Wasinski discovers that his deafness is linked to a frightening childhood experience. During his consultation the doctor discovers gauze buried deep within his ear canal and upon its removal Mr. Wasinski becomes vulnerable to a barrage of repressed childhood memories. Having lived as a child in Poland during Nazi occupation Mr. Wasinski’s deafness marks the loss of his innocence as a child when separated from his parents during a desperate attempt to escape. The vivid memories suppressed with the aid of his deafness prove a challenge to an aging man who seeks distance from his childhood experiences. Stars Bruce Kerr as Mr Wasinski.
